g.text: suitable to describe the EMs in high pressure. In order to
obtain reasonable BKH parameters, the FIT potential
were chosen for the initial values directly,
and the ﬁtting bounds were conﬁned to be 0.9 and 1.1 times of
the parameter. In addition, the least-square method was used
to optimize the parameter referring to the dimer energies in
For bonding interactions, a series of perturbed structures
were generated based on one of the equilibrium conformations
according to the redundant internal coordinates, and
optimized with the constrained structural parameters at the
PBE0/aug-cc-pVDZ level, and the harmonic style functions
were chosen for bond and angle terms (
are the force constants of bond and angle
are the actual and balanced bond lengths, while
are the actual and balanced bond angles. A fourier
style potential was chosen to describe dihedral terms (
are the force constants, scale factor, and
actual and balanced dihedral angels. To ﬁx the nitro group
planer, a harmonic improper term was chosen for nitro groups
are the force constants and improper angle,
and the initial bonding parameters were obtained from Amber
FF parameters. In order to get reliable results, the bounds of
the evolutionary algorithm was employed to optimize the
parameters with minimization of the following score function
is the slope determined by the linear ﬁtting between
with the optimizations at several structural parameter
can be applied to balance between the
slope and root mean square error. It is worth noting that all
during the parameterization. In all DFT/MM optimization and
energy calculation were performed with Gaussian 09
calculations were carried out with the
time step length and cutoﬀ distance of vdW interaction were
set to 0.5 fs and 12 Å, respectively. In order to ensure that all
the edge lengths of the cell were at the least twice cutoﬀ
distance, a bulk supercell of a 5
cell was used. All structure relaxations were performed for 100
ps from 0 to 20 GPa at 300 K. After equilibration at each
pressure, atomic conﬁgurations were recorded every 1000th
step, and the last 20 000 step trajectories were gathered. By
statistical average, we obtained the mean lattice parameters,
atom coordinates, volume, center of mass, etc. In addition, a
gaseous molecular structure was also optimized with the FF.
All calculations in this part were implemented in the LAMMPS
molecule is a planar structure with
in the gaseous phase. Thus, atom types were deﬁned referring
to the chemical groups and their connections.
the structural overlap between FF and DFT. Overall, the
structure from the FF is very similar with that from DFT. In
compares the structural parameters optimized at
the PBE0/aug-cc-pVDZ and ﬁtted FF levels. Because of the
planar structure, dihedral and improper angles are not
included. Obviously, the parameters from the FF are in good
agreement with those from DFT. The mean error (ME) of
bond lengths is about 0.006 Å, and the ME of bond angles is
. The root mean squared error (RMSE) of bond
lengths and angels are 0.015 Å and 1.0
(MAXE) about bond lengths existing in the bond between C1
and N12 is about 0.20 Å. Among bond angles, the MAXE is
simulation, the equilibrium crystal structure was obtained
with averaging lattice parameters and atom coordinates in last
simulated and experimental structures. In the 15/15 similarity
standard, the displacement between two structures is
structure from the FF is very similar with that from the
compares the lattice parameters based on
Compared to the experimental and DFT
calculated values, our FF gives a slightly smaller lattice cell.
The lattice parameters were predicted to be 5.64, 15.55, and
8.24 Å for a, b, and c axis, respectively. The lengths of a, b, and
c decreases by about 0.08, 0.30, and 0.18 Å, or 1.4, 1.9, and
. Because of the little shorter axis, the
